cluster_relations.rel_desc: Fully developed butterfly wings enable the butterfly's ability to fly.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Biological Structures and Substances in Butterfly Metamorphosis

cluster_relations.rel_desc: In the adult butterfly life stage, the organism is capable of flight.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: for the first time in adult stage

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The proboscis is used to drink nectar as food.
The stages of the butterfly life cycle collectively support the survival and reproduction of butterflies.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: throughout all stages from egg to adult

remarks: Models the aggregate effect of all stages as a property of the life cycle.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject feature or structure makes the object function or capability possible.
args.justification: The relation describes fully developed butterfly wings making flight possible; a general predicate 'enables' captures this functional enablement between structure and capability.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject entity has the capability to perform or exhibit the object function.
args.justification: The adult butterfly life stage is described as being capable of flight; a capability relation from life stage to function is best modeled as 'has_capability_for'.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject structure is used to consume or ingest the object substance as food.
args.justification: The proboscis is functionally used to drink (consume) nectar; modeling this as 'used_to_consume' captures the tool-like use of a body part to ingest a food resource.
args.remark: Object is the consumed substance (nectar), not the action of drinking.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject process or set of stages contributes causally to the survival and reproduction of the object organisms.
args.justification: The butterfly life cycle is said to support the survival and reproduction of butterflies; retaining a clear causal-support predicate explicitly tied to survival and reproduction is appropriate.

Both relations connect biological entities (wings, life stage) with a functional capability (flight): one via enablement and one via direct capability attribution. Grouping them under a shared capability-focused class reflects their common semantics.
This relation links a feeding-related body part (proboscis) to a food resource (nectar) via its use in feeding; it fits a class covering anatomical structures and their feeding/ingestion functions.

The life cycle stages are described as supporting survival and reproduction, which directly concern biological fitness; this warrants a class focused on processes that support or enhance organismal survival and reproduction.

Both relations express functional capabilities (flight) enabled or possessed by biological entities rather than general causality or composition; they naturally fall under a broad functionality dimension.
This relation models the use of an anatomical structure (proboscis) to consume a resource (nectar), which is best grouped under a broad usage/functional-use dimension.
The life cycle is said to support survival and reproduction, a clear causal contribution to organismal outcomes; this belongs naturally in a broad causality group.
